results.title: A Pride of islands
results.brief_description: Visiting the island of the Hebrides showing how they fish, farm and weave to make a living. The only airport in the world to the covered by water twice a day. The old battlements, castles and monuments 3000 years old. Safe haven from the sea for sailors of all nations.
results.description: Visiting the island of the Hebrides showing how they fish, farm and weave to make a living. The only airport in the world to the covered by water twice a day. The old battlements, castles and monuments 3000 years old. Safe haven from the sea for sailors of all nations.

results.title: A Priceless day = Ajandek ez a nap [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Peter Gothar, Magyar Film, Hungarofilm and Budapest Filmstudio
results.brief_description: Adapted from a short story by Peter Zimre, “A Priceless day” is a quirky drama which centres around several characters whose lives are interwoven for various reasons, but not always the right reasons. Iren Zemann (Cecilia Esztergalyos) is a thirty something kindergarten teacher who is forced to move from her apartment when her elderly landlady dies. At the same time she is also mistress to Attila (Pal Hetenyi), a married man with children who has just told his wife Anna (Judit Pogany) about his affair with Iren. Attila, through his friend Hevesi, decides to find Iren a new apartment but all manner of complications ensue as Hevesi becomes involved in some rather underhanded dealings in securing Iren her new apartment, including a forced marriage in name only to Gabi (Janos Derzsi), a much younger single man, who would very much like to take advantage of his situation with Iren. An eventual meeting between Iren and Attila’s wife Anna provides a resulting ironic twist to the story. Set in 1970s Hungary, this is quite a poignant story reflecting the bleakness and the bureaucracy of the times. (Awards: Winner of the Golden Lion Award, Venice Film Festival, 1980)
results.title_for_label: A Priceless day = Ajandek ez a nap [NTSC]

results.title: A Practical guide to worm farming
results.brief_description: This video contains practical information on setting up a commercial worm farm, including: Pros and cons of different bed construction, worm biology/why worms, pests - including flatworms, common problems and how to overcome them, bedding, feeds, covers and harvesting.

results.title: A Potter's world
results.brief_description: The craftsmanship of Bernard Leach who, after a number of years in the East, established a pottery in Cornwall. The influence of the Orient on his work is indicated.

results.title: A Pot of message
results.brief_description: Argues that Australians eat and drink too much and do not exercise enough. Because much of modern food is highly refined it lacks basic nutrition. Although there is a growing awareness of the need to eat more natural food it must be remembered that health foods and vitamin pills are not really the answer.

results.title: A Positive approach to the psychiatric patient
results.brief_description: Shows the treatment in Veterans Administration hospital for psychiatric patients who have emerged from acute episodes of mental illness but who are not yet well enough to leave the hospital. Uses a hospital ward unit as the focal setting, and stresses the roles of the nurse aide and physician.
